data.title: The 60 Best Movies With Key in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 50 filmgoers have voted on the 60 Best Movies With Key in the Title. Current Top 3: Key Largo, The Skeleton Key, The Key
data.text:
How many movies with key in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with key in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with key in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with key in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with key in the title include Key Largo, The Skeleton Key, and Sarah's Key, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the key movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Humphrey Bogart, Edward G. Robinson, Lauren Bacall

Released : 1948

Directed by : John Huston

Centered around a tense standoff between a war veteran and a ruthless gangster in a remote Florida hotel, this classic film noir boasts stellar performances from Humphrey Bogart and Edward G. Robinson. The suspenseful atmosphere and well-crafted dialogue make for a truly unforgettable cinematic experience.

Kate Hudson, Gena Rowlands, John Hurt

Released : 2005

Directed by : Iain Softley

This spine-chilling thriller revolves around a hospice nurse who becomes entangled in a web of dark secrets and mysticism within a crumbling Louisiana plantation. With its atmospheric setting and bone-chilling plot twists, this film is sure to keep audiences on the edge of their seats.

3

The Key

Sergey Martinson, Georgiy Vitsin, Rina Zelyonaya

Released : 1961

Directed by : Lev Atamanov

In this gripping WWII drama, a weary tugboat captain reluctantly takes command of a beleaguered vessel. As he grapples with his past and present struggles, the film delivers a powerful examination of love, loyalty, and duty.

Milburn Stone, Dennis Moore, Addison Richards

Released : 1945

Directed by : Lewis D. Collins, Ray Taylor

This captivating serial film delves into the world of espionage as a clever investigator uncovers a mysterious criminal organization. With a new cliffhanger in each installment, audiences were left eagerly awaiting the next twist and turn.

5

The Seventh Key

This nail-biting horror film sees a group of friends uncover an ancient artifact that unwittingly unleashes a malevolent force upon them. As they struggle to break the curse, the tension and terror escalate, making for a truly chilling cinematic experience.

William Holden, Sophia Loren, Trevor Howard

Released : 1958

Directed by : Carol Reed

Set amidst the turmoil of the Russian Revolution, this romantic drama follows a beautiful young woman caught between two men vying for her affection. Filled with passion, intrigue, and heartache, viewers are bound to be swept up in the poignant tale.
